comments:
Build 20021018

I was browsing code in the Java perspective, when an error occurred. The 
outliner stopped updating and the following stack trace was in my log file 
repeatedly. Closing and reopening the Outliner didn't help.

looks like a bug / problem in sun.text.resources.LocaleElements
(ViewerSorter calls Collator.getInstance()).

I have no idea what we can do here. Is it reproducible?

It's only happened to me on one occasion, but on that occasion, I got this 
stack trace repeatedly, including during shutdown. When I then tried to 
relaunch Eclipse, I found that Eclipse no longer recognized any of the 
projects in my workspace (they didn't show up in the Navigator, etc.). I had 
to trash the workspace and start over to get back to work.
Moving to platform. Maybe they have an idea.
Note that it's the ViewerSorter that creates the problematic Locale

This is a problem with the JDK you are using - it is generating a 
NullPointerException when attempting to get a new instance of Locale - there 
isn't anything we can do about this.
Can you provide a bug report number from bug parade?

The reason I am asking for the bug parade ref is that it is not clear where the NPE is coming from.  The bytecodes look like they are for a constant array (a bunch of strings).  (It could be a vm defect?)

I think you are right but you would have to point me at where to look in bug 
parade - I am not familiar with what you are referring to.

Here's the Bug Parade URL:
http://developer.java.sun.com/servlet/SessionServlet?url=http://developer.java.sun.com/developer/bugParade/

Checked there and there is no reference to a NullPointerException on the 
Collator there.

Please provide VM information before asking if there is information about it 
logged elsewhere - I assume this means you are using a Sun runtime and not one 
of the IBM JREs.

java version "1.4.1-rc"
Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build 1.4.1-rc-b15)
Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM (build 1.4.1-rc-b15, mixed mode)

There have been a lot of 1.4.x related issues - please append this VM 
information at the beginning of any PR you log while using this VM as it is 
frequently the cause of problems that appear to be something else - this can 
save a lot of back and forth time trying to see if it is a problem with an 
officially supported (1.3.1) VM.

It looks like it is missing a resource bundle for your Locale. I assume it is 
English US you are using - what is your default codepage?

Reopening and marking as Unconfirmed pending reproducable test case.

Removing Martin as I think this is generating more mail than it needs to and I 
don't want to spam you. Please add yourself back if this was wrong.

I just got this problem again with JDK 1.4.1 build 15. On a hunch, we went out looking for a newer version of the 1.4.1 VM and found build 19. I'll start running that version to see if the problem goes away.

How are you getting access to these later builds? It would be good if Adrian 
could get us set up so that everyone could have a crack at them to verfiy 
these issues.
I just got this problem again with JDK 1.4.1 build 19.
I just got the problem again on JDK 1.3.1_03.

I get this problem on JDK 1.4.2 and JDK 1.5.0. I even tried upgrading my OS from Mandrake 9.2 to 
Mandrake 10.1 and I still see this bug.
Is this still an issue in 3.2?
Haven't seen the problem in years.
